conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C due to gravity.
Point A is located near the top left corner.
Liquid from point A will flow downward and encounter the first baffle (purple).
The purple baffle will direct the liquid from point A towards the right.
After the purple baffle, the liquid from point A will continue flowing downward and encounter the green baffle.
The green baffle will further direct the liquid from point A towards the right.
Liquid from point A will flow into container D.
Point B is located near the top center.
Liquid from point B will flow downward and encounter the purple baffle.
The purple baffle will direct the liquid from point B towards the right.
After the purple baffle, the liquid from point B will continue flowing downward and encounter the green baffle.
The green baffle will further direct the liquid from point B towards the right.
Liquid from point B will flow into container E.
Point C is located near the top right corner.
Liquid from point C will flow downward and encounter the purple baffle.
The purple baffle will direct the liquid from point C towards the right.
After the purple baffle, the liquid from point C will continue flowing downward and encounter the brown baffle.
The brown baffle will direct the liquid from point C towards the right.
Liquid from point C will flow into container F.
Final answer: Liquid from point A will flow into container D, from point B into container E, and from point C into container F.
